channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13431] Allow to skip store file range check based on column family while creating reference files in HRegionFileSystem#splitStoreFile
item.description:
APPROACH #3 at PHOENIX-1734 helps to implement local indexing without much changes in HBase. For split we need one kernel change to allow creating both top and bottom reference files for index column family store files even when the split key not in the storefile key range.
The changes helps in this case are
1) pass boolean to HRegionFileSystem#splitStoreFile to allow to skip the storefile key range check.
2) move the splitStoreFile with extra boolean parameter to the new interface introduced at HBASE-12975.
item.summary: Allow to skip store file range check based on column family while creating reference files in HRegionFileSystem#splitStoreFile

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Any chance of patch Andrew Purtell. It would be better to go this in 1.1.0.
Thanks.
Yes I think I can manage a patch here this week
Where do we stand with this one. Clock is ticking on 1.1?
Here is simple patch.

http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12728787/HBASE-13431.patch
against master branch at commit 84dd84fc581d2984daf5e523276b76181c1de5e7.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12728787

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

-1 javac. The patch appears to cause mvn compile goal to fail with Hadoop version 2.4.1.

Compilation errors resume:

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13863//console

This message is automatically generated.
What is the issue if we continue to get the skipStoreFileRangeCheck boolean from RegionSplitPolicy?

Anoop Sam John

What is the issue if we continue to get the skipStoreFileRangeCheck boolean from RegionSplitPolicy?

To support PHOENIX-1734 we should skip the range check for index column families only. So we need to check column family name as well.
What do you say for this patch?

Can't we just use the default RegionSplitPolicy for non index cfs and extended (Phoenix own) one for index cf?
Why I say is, passing the policy looks cleaner than a boolean. This will be forward compatible also.

I see got why we you pass the cf name to policy method. Looks good to me.
BTW you missed the new method from SplitTransaction in v2 patch?

BTW you missed the new method from SplitTransaction in v2 patch?

Need not change anything in SplitTransaction Anoop.

Changed tests to verify whether we can skip range check based on family or not.
So the title of the Jira no longer holds true.. I thought still you want to move the split API be in SplitTransaction interface.

The patch makes sense. In some offline discussion, it was not clear whether RegionSplitPolicy is a valid extension point or not. If we are concerned about supporting users who implemented it, I think we can deprecate the method and introduce the override.
Patch avoids compatibility issues in case if users already implemented skipStoreFileRangeCheck() in their custom split policy. Thanks Anoop and Enis for review.
v4 doesn't quite apply cleanly to branch-1.1. Mind posting branch-specific patches?

Nick Dimiduk uploaded patches for branch-1.0+
Thanks.

branch-1.0 patch picks cleanly back to 0.98. Updated unit test passes. All split transaction unit tests pass. Modifies RegionSplit, which is annotated LP(Config), so this is fine. Just to be careful I also checked this change against the Phoenix '4.3' and '4.x-HBase-0.98' builds.
